Body:
I'm curious about language acquisition among twins. I've heard it said that they often develop their own language (of sorts) and I was wondering if anyone has done any studies of this phenomenon.

  • Is it more common in certain languages/ language families?
  • Are there societal or gender-based factors to this development?
  • How complete is this "language" likely to be?
Title: Studies of Twin Speak

LastEditedUser.AboutMe: Ask a question on the new Linguistics site on Stack Exchange.

OwnerUser.AboutMe:
Hi there. I'm a college student originally from Upstate NY, USA. My stunted childhood was spent reading too many books and hoping I would grow up to be Han Solo. Still waiting on that last bit.

I spend most of my free time knitting polyhedral dice.
